learnings.issue: Page column only showed page number without clause reference
learnings.correction: Page column must include both page number AND clause reference: 'Page X, Clause Y(a)'
learnings.rule: NEVER use just page numbers alone. ALWAYS provide specific clause location within page.

learnings.issue: Marked Design Liability as Compliant when contract required broader design scope than shop drawings
learnings.correction: Contract requiring 'design, planning, setout, certification, maintenance' EXCEEDS DuraCube's limited 'shop drawings' standard = NON-COMPLIANT
learnings.rule: Any contract requiring broader design scope than shop drawings = NON-COMPLIANT. DuraCube's design scope is LIMITED to shop drawings only.

examples.compliant: Design scope limited to shop drawings
examples.non_compliant: Design, planning, setout, certification, maintenance of works included in scope

learnings.correction: N/A or 0% security = COMPLIANT and FAVORABLE (Better than DuraCube standard of 5%)
learnings.rule: No security required < DuraCube standard (5%) = COMPLIANT. Absence of security burden is FAVORABLE.

learnings.issue: Confused Defects Liability Period with separate WARRANTY provisions
learnings.correction: DLP and Warranty are DIFFERENT concepts. Analyze ONLY the DLP clause for Principle 17, ignore warranty schedules.
learnings.rule: DLP = Main contract term (typically 52 weeks). Warranty = Separate clause, often in schedules. For Principle 17, analyze ONLY the DLP clause.

examples.dlp_correct: Page 39, Item 15: '52 weeks' = DLP = analyze this
examples.warranty_ignore: Page 162, Schedule 3: 'Joinery - 7 years' = Warranty = do NOT analyze for Principle 17

learnings.issue: Marked Release of Security as Non-Compliant when no security was required
learnings.correction: If Principle 15 = COMPLIANT (no security), then Principle 16 = AUTOMATICALLY COMPLIANT
learnings.rule: Cannot have security release issues when no security exists. No security = No release problems = COMPLIANT.

learnings.issue: Marked unconditional Bank Guarantees as Compliant
learnings.correction: 'Unconditional Bank Guarantees' directly violates DuraCube's standard = NON-COMPLIANT. DuraCube ONLY accepts DATED bank guarantees.
learnings.rule: Unconditional/on-demand guarantees = NON-COMPLIANT. Dated guarantees only. BG1 expires at PC, BG2 expires 52 weeks after PC.

examples.compliant: Two dated bank guarantees, each for 2.5%
examples.non_compliant: Two unconditional bank guarantees without expiry date

learnings.issue: Analyzed executed/marked-up contract terms instead of original template language
learnings.correction: Analyze ONLY original contract template text. IGNORE all strikethroughs, insertions, highlights, and DocuSign field completions.
learnings.rule: Compliance assessment is against ORIGINAL TEMPLATE language, not marked-up/executed terms. Struck-through text = Original language to analyze. Inserted text = Ignore.

examples.correct_analysis: Original: 'Two unconditional bank guarantees' = Analyze this
examples.incorrect_analysis: Inserted: '2 X dated bank guarantees' = Do NOT analyze this for compliance

learnings.issue: Marked $5M insurance requirement as Non-Compliant when DuraCube limit is $20M
learnings.correction: Lower customer insurance requirement is MORE FAVORABLE. Customer requirement < DuraCube limit = COMPLIANT.
learnings.rule: Customer requirement <= DuraCube limit ($20M) = COMPLIANT. Only flag as Non-Compliant if customer requires MORE than DuraCube provides.

learnings.issue: Marked absence of insurance requirements as 'No Term' requiring departure
learnings.correction: Absence of specified insurance limits is FAVORABLE. No insurance requirements = COMPLIANT (no burden on DuraCube).
learnings.rule: Absence of burden terms = FAVORABLE = COMPLIANT, not 'No Term'. Only insert insurance terms if customer requires MORE than DuraCube provides.

examples.compliant: Contract mentions insurance but no limits specified

learnings.issue: Relied on project schedule 'days' duration field instead of calculating actual calendar period
learnings.correction: Calculate actual calendar period between START DATE and END DATE. Do NOT rely on schedule duration fields.
learnings.rule: 52 weeks = 364 days. Calculate from start to end date using calendar. Schedule 'duration' fields show remaining time from reference date, NOT contractual DLP period.

examples.correct: Jan 23, 2026 to Jan 22, 2027 = 364 days = 52 weeks = COMPLIANT
examples.incorrect: 239 days shown in schedule = Do NOT use this number

learnings.issue: Suggested departures to INSERT insurance/security obligations when contract had none
learnings.correction: Never suggest departures that ADD obligations when none exist. Absence of burden terms is FAVORABLE.
learnings.rule: Protective terms absent (liability cap, EOT) -> Insert departure needed. Burden terms absent (insurance, guarantees) -> COMPLIANT, no departure.

decision_tree.protective_term_missing: Insert departure to add protection for DuraCube
decision_tree.burden_term_missing: COMPLIANT - favorable position, no departure needed

no_term_assessment.question: Would this term PROTECT or BURDEN DuraCube?

protect.action: Status: NO TERM -> Departure needed to insert protection

key_rules: N/A or 0% security = COMPLIANT and FAVORABLE
BG1 expires at PC, BG2 expires 52 weeks after PC
DLP and Warranty are DIFFERENT - analyze separately
Calculate actual calendar period between dates
Design scope limited to shop drawings only
No Professional Indemnity = DuraCube provides no professional design services
Page references must include clause numbers
Analyze original template, not marked-up text
Protective term absent = NO TERM = departure needed
